title: Chinas INSANE NEW Bamboo Farming Techniques

subtasks: Spreading bamboo seeds on farmland
Watering bamboo plants after seed germination
Transferring young bamboo saplings to plastic bags
Cutting and dividing mature bamboo into sections
Planting bamboo sections in soil with hole for water retention
Propagating bamboo through roots (distinguishing between running and clumping varieties)
Using the tree branching method to propagate new plants
Digging up and transplanting existing plant sections
Utilizing tissue culture methods for bamboo propagation

tasks.task: Analyzing China's success in bamboo cultivation
subtasks: Considering geographical location and climate
Evaluating natural and man-made bamboo forests
Assessing the role of varied innovative techniques

tasks.task: Those seem like the main agricultural tasks. But then the rest of the transcript is more about the geographical advantages, the number of species, and the environmental conditions.
